title: Issue 343
summary: MAUI Preview 14. Get ready for that GA!

items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #343 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrapup of the Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

This week we have the release of MAUI Preview 14 as well as new Visual Studio Mac previews.

Have a great weekend everyone.

♥️

Kym
items.description_markdown:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #343 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrapup of the Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

This week we have the release of MAUI Preview 14 as well as new Visual Studio Mac previews.

Have a great weekend everyone.

♥️

Kym

items.title: Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 14
items.description:
.NET MAUI Preview 14 has shipped with plenty of great new features to try out including a hefty volume of issue resolutions and features, including the MenuBar!

Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 14 by David Ortinau
items.description_markdown:
.NET MAUI Preview 14 has shipped with plenty of great new features to try out including a hefty volume of issue resolutions and features, including the MenuBar!

[**Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 14**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-maui-preview-14/) by [David Ortinau](https://twitter.com/davidortinau)

items.title: How you should be using (and naming) resources in XAML
items.description:
Naming things is hard. This is true of code, but also XAML resources. Here are a couple of tips and best practices.

items.title: Hello, .NET MAUI Preview 14 with Essential Interfaces and Desktop MenuBars!
items.description:
That is right, .NET MAUI Preview 14 is here and is so close to Release Candidate state! Preview 14 of .NET Multi-platform App UI (MAUI) is now available in Visual Studio 2022 17.2 Preview 2 and includes a hefty volume of issue resolutions and completed features, and one new feature that will be a welcome addition for desktop developers: the MenuBar.

Hello, .NET MAUI Preview 14 with Essential Interfaces and Desktop MenuBars! by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
That is right, .NET MAUI Preview 14 is here and is so close to Release Candidate state! Preview 14 of .NET Multi-platform App UI (MAUI) is now available in Visual Studio 2022 17.2 Preview 2 and includes a hefty volume of issue resolutions and completed features, and one new feature that will be a welcome addition for desktop developers: the MenuBar. 

[**Hello, .NET MAUI Preview 14 with Essential Interfaces and Desktop MenuBars!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OfzAbxC7m6s) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **Hello, .NET MAUI Preview 14 with Essential Interfaces and Desktop MenuBars!**

items.title: Easily Show Platform-Specific Dialogs with .NET MAUI Blazor
items.description:
Need to show prompts or dialogs from your Blazor application? With .NET MAUI it almost couldn't be easier! Write a little wrapper leveraging dependency injection and you can access all the power of .NET MAUI and the underlaying platforms straight from your Blazor application.

Easily Show Platform-Specific Dialogs with .NET MAUI Blazor by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Need to show prompts or dialogs from your Blazor application? With .NET MAUI it almost couldn't be easier! Write a little wrapper leveraging dependency injection and you can access all the power of .NET MAUI and the underlaying platforms straight from your Blazor application.


[**Easily Show Platform-Specific Dialogs with .NET MAUI Blazor**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gTLEIe0SWpI) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **Easily Show Platform-Specific Dialogs with .NET MAUI Blazor**

items.title: Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 7
items.description:
Visual Studio 2022 for Mac 17.0 Preview 7 is here and continues the focus on addressing top issues and driving forward to a high-quality GA (general availability) release. In addition to many fixes, this release brings back Xamarin mobile tooling as a supported experience and introduces Azure Functions V4 tooling which supports running on .NET 6 & M1 processors.

Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 7 by Jordan Matthiesen
items.description_markdown:
Visual Studio 2022 for Mac 17.0 Preview 7 is here and continues the focus on addressing top issues and driving forward to a high-quality GA (general availability) release. In addition to many fixes, this release brings back Xamarin mobile tooling as a supported experience and introduces Azure Functions V4 tooling which supports running on .NET 6 & M1 processors.

[**Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 7**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/visual-studio-2022-for-mac-preview-7) by [Jordan Matthiesen](https://twitter.com/jmatthiesen)
